question: In Ghana, the author of this section discovered which of the following as it relates to the relationship between government and private journalists?

answers.text: State journalists were given special treatment and incentives, while private journalists were largely banned by the government and viewed as political enemies.
Private journalists were given special treatment and incentives, while state journalists were largely banned by the government and viewed as political enemies.
Gifts called soli were given to journalists to encourage them to write from the perspective of the state.
Private journalists worked with state journalists to represent the views of the state.
